meanings.definition: To store goods in a warehouse.
meanings.sent1: The company warehoused their products to keep them safe.
meanings.sent2: The workers warehoused the new inventory in the storage facility.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels warehoused nuts in the tree hollow, creating a secret stash.
meanings.sent4: She warehoused memories in her heart, treasuring them forever.
meanings.sent5: The chef warehoused fresh ingredients in the fridge, ready for cooking.

meanings.sent1: The warehouse was full of warehoused goods waiting to be shipped.
meanings.sent2: The inventory list showed various warehoused items in stock.
meanings.sent3: The children imagined the warehouse as a treasure trove of warehoused toys.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a vast warehouse, with memories warehoused neatly on shelves.
meanings.sent5: The warehouse echoed with the silence of warehoused goods, patiently waiting.
